Voltage Comparator (VCOMP)
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides voltage comparator functionality for Apollo5 devices, supporting analog voltage monitoring, threshold detection, and reference voltage comparison. It enables precise analog signal processing for applications requiring voltage level monitoring and control.

Key Features

  1. Voltage Comparison: Compare input voltages against reference levels.
  2. DAC Reference: Configurable DAC reference voltage generation.
  3. Input Selection: Flexible positive and negative input selection.
  4. Interrupt Support: Interrupt generation on comparison events.
  5. Status Monitoring: Real-time comparator output status reading.

Functionality

  • Configure voltage comparator parameters and input selection
  • Set up DAC reference levels for comparison
  • Enable/disable the voltage comparator
  • Handle comparator interrupts and status monitoring
  • Read comparator output status in real-time

Usage

  1. Configure the comparator using am_hal_vcomp_config()
  2. Set DAC reference levels as needed
  3. Enable the comparator with am_hal_vcomp_enable()
  4. Handle comparator interrupts if enabled
  5. Monitor comparator status for voltage level changes

Configuration

  • Input Selection: Choose positive and negative input sources
  • DAC Levels: Configure DAC reference voltage levels
  • Interrupts: Enable/disable comparator interrupts
  • Power Management: Control comparator power states

Enum for the positive input selection to the VCOMP

  AM_HAL_VCOMP_POSSEL_VTEMP ,
  AM_HAL_VCOMP_POSSEL_VEXT1 ,
  AM_HAL_VCOMP_POSSEL_VEXT2
}

  AM_HAL_VCOMP_NEGSEL_VREFEXT3 ,
  AM_HAL_VCOMP_NEGSEL_DAC
}

#define AM_HAL_VCOMP_CONFIG_DEFAULT
 Default structrue for the configuration struct Use VDDADJ for positive input Use DAC for negative input Use 0.58V as the voltage level for DAC.
 

Interrupt bit fields

Interrupt bit fields for interrupt related registers configuration

These macros may be used to set and clear interrupt bits

#define AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTLOW_Msk   (1 << VCOMP_INTSTAT_OUTLOW_Pos)
 
#define AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTHI_Msk   (1 << VCOMP_INTSTAT_OUTHI_Pos)
 
#define AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_ALL_Msk
 

VCOMP Status Bits

Status bit for the VCOM STAT register

These macros may be used to monitor VCOM STAT register

#define AM_HAL_VCOMP_STAT_CMPOUT   1 << VCOMP_STAT_CMPOUT_Pos
 
#define AM_HAL_VCOMP_STAT_PWDSTAT   1 << VCOMP_STAT_PWDSTAT_Pos
 
#define AM_REG_VCOMP_PWDKEY_KEYVAL   0x00000037

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_vcomp_config()

am_hal_status_e am_hal_vcomp_config ( const am_hal_vcomp_config_t * psConfig)

Configure the Voltage Comparator module.

Parameters
psConfigis a structure containing configuration information for the voltage comparator.

This function configures the positive and negative input signals for the voltage comparator.

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or AM_HAL_STATUS_FAIL

◆ am_hal_vcomp_dac_level_set()

am_hal_status_e am_hal_vcomp_dac_level_set ( am_hal_vcomp_dac_lvlsel_e eLevelSelect)

Set the Voltage Comparator DAC Level Select in Configuration Reg.

Parameters
eLevelSelect- DAC voltage selector (use macros enumerations)

This function sets the DAC level select in the configuration register.

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or AM_HAL_STATUS_FAIL

◆ am_hal_vcomp_disable()

void am_hal_vcomp_disable ( void )

Disable the voltage comparator.

This function powers down the voltage comparator.

Returns
None

◆ am_hal_vcomp_enable()

void am_hal_vcomp_enable ( void )

Enable the voltage comparator.

This function powers up the voltage comparator.

Returns
None

◆ am_hal_vcomp_int_clear()

am_hal_status_e am_hal_vcomp_int_clear ( uint32_t ui32Interrupt)

Clear the state of the voltage comparator interrupt status bits.

Parameters
ui32Interrupt- interrupts to be cleared.

This function clears the specified interrupt status bits.

ui32Interrupt should be a logical or of:

AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTLOW_CLR AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTHI_CLR

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or AM_HAL_STATUS_FAIL

◆ am_hal_vcomp_int_disable()

am_hal_status_e am_hal_vcomp_int_disable ( uint32_t ui32Interrupt)

Disable the voltage comparator interrupt status bits.

Parameters
ui32Interrupt- interrupts to be disabled.

This function disables desired interrupt status bits.

ui32Interrupt should be a logical or of:

AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTLOW_SET AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTHI_SET

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or AM_HAL_STATUS_FAIL

◆ am_hal_vcomp_int_enable()

am_hal_status_e am_hal_vcomp_int_enable ( uint32_t ui32Interrupt)

Enable the voltage comparator interrupt status bits.

Parameters
ui32Interrupt- interrupts to be enabled.

This function enables desired interrupt status bits.

ui32Interrupt should be a logical or of:

AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTLOW_EN AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTHI_EN

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or AM_HAL_STATUS_FAIL

◆ am_hal_vcomp_int_enable_get()

uint32_t am_hal_vcomp_int_enable_get ( void )

Return the enabled, voltage comparator interrupt status bits.

This function returns the enabled interrupt status bits

Returns
returns the enabled interrupt status bits. The return is a logical or of:

AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTLOW_STAT AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTHI_STAT

◆ am_hal_vcomp_int_set()

am_hal_status_e am_hal_vcomp_int_set ( uint32_t ui32Interrupt)

Set the state of the voltage comparator interrupt status bits.

Parameters
ui32Interrupt- interrupts to be set.

This function sets the specified interrupt status bits.

ui32Interrupt should be a logical or of:

AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTLOW_SET AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTHI_SET

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or AM_HAL_STATUS_FAIL

◆ am_hal_vcomp_int_status_get()

uint32_t am_hal_vcomp_int_status_get ( bool bEnabledOnly)

Read the state of the voltage comparator interrupt status bits.

Parameters
bEnabledOnly- return the status of only the enabled interrupts.

This function extracts the interrupt status bits and returns the raw or only the enabled based on bEnabledOnly.

Returns
Bitwise representation of the current interrupt status.

The return value will be the logical OR of one or more of the following values:

AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTLOW_STAT AM_HAL_VCOMP_INT_OUTHI_STAT

◆ am_hal_vcomp_status_get()

uint32_t am_hal_vcomp_status_get ( void )

Read the state of the voltage comparator.

This function extracts the comparator state from the status register.

Returns
the voltage comparator state

The DAC level setting.

◆ eNegInput

am_hal_vcomp_negsel_e am_hal_vcomp_config_t::eNegInput

The "negative" comparator input channel This channel is usually used as the reference signal.

◆ ePosInput

am_hal_vcomp_possel_e am_hal_vcomp_config_t::ePosInput

The "positive" comparator input channel This channel is usually used as the signal to be monitored.
